reviews.review:
Bioshock Infinite, also known as Run Forward While Shooting, Ayn Rand edition.
Most game play actually did not consist of Running Forward While Shooting, but rather it was more boring as I stood perfectly still lining up incredibly boring headshots on AI that would generally stand pefectly still.

Now, I am not a 'hardcore' game player by any respect. I enjoy my shooters arena like and my plots sufficient in narrative capacities. I don't want to devote hours to learning Meta outside of a game. But when a game has AI that cannot even be arsed to move and shoot competently, I can't even handle how completely bored I am.

Definitely an excellent example of why not to buy games from EA.

Do you want a game with worse gunplay and plasmid uses than the other two Bioshock games? Do you want an ending that trys to be deep just to be deep? Do you want worse plasmids than Bioshock? Do you want what looks like a big boss enemy actually not be a cool fight after all after he is instantly killed at the end? If you want a pretentious crap ending with worse gameplay and the only thing going for it is the cool setting then look no further than Bioshock Infinite.

This game had so much potential it's a shame.
Dang dude. Like, dang dude. DANG DUDE! Daaaaaaaaaaaang duuuuuuuuude. Dang dude. Dang-Dude. Dang, dude.
Holy crap man! I LOVE THIS DARN GAME!!!

Bioshock Infinte is an absolute amazing game! The plot and character development are very immersing and intricately blended together. It is evident that the gameplay, although innovative by paralleling the original Bioshock style, is rather repetitive and drags on at times. In saying that, however, the sheer genius of Ken Levine and Irrational Games' writing department have countered this minor element ('minor' as the gameplay is not in itself boring or disfunctional, just a tad repetative) with the distraction of the unique complexity of the story line. Visually, Bioshock Inifinite is stunning. Realism has been sacrificed for a beautifully vibrant art style making the game an absolute pleasure to play! This game is a must for all original Bioshock fans with subtle (and not so subtle) throw-backs. Totally worth every penny :)
Klasse Spiel...Selten so gut unterhalten worden..würde ich auf jeden Fall wieder kaufen und spielen
Bioshock Infite is AWESOMMEEEEE BEST story ever and love the game plays :D

I heard all the great things about this game and ended up buying it during a sale despite my dislike for FPS. I  started BioShock Inifinite and finished in a matter of days. It sucks you in, and you won't ever want to leave. I highly reccommend this game! It's THAT GOOD.
Despite having not cared for Bioshock 1 at all. I have no qualms about giving Bioshock: Infinite a 10/10.

Gripping storyline, amazing graphics and fantastic gameplay... What more can you ask?
One of the best games I've ever played in my life. Period.
best story line

My overall experience with Bioshock Infinite is quite pleasing, I stayed engrossed in the game for a full day as I beat the storyline on the highest initially available difficulty in just under 13hours.  There are a few things to keep in mind when deciding if you want to buy this game however.

First is that as a FPS game it is very much lacking. The AI is passable only as exceptional if you went and opened a tear back to 2004. Ontop of this easily duped and poor pathing AI we have what amounts overall to a console port to PC with all the shoddy controls you would expect from such.  Unless you have triple jointed fingers or a couple extra thumbs you will find yourself remapping over half the keys like I did just to make the game playable. 

Now ontop of all this we have a rather unoriginal core plot that you could figuratively say is copy and pasted from the now dated title Singularity, all the way down to the ending revelations.  Plot twists are rather obvious and seen coming several load screens away.

Now with all there are a number of redeeming qualities to the game.  First and most noticable for me is that it does away with the constant repetative "tunnel" rooms from the first two installments where in every enemy, spawn method, and environment was just a reconfiguration of the previous room with pointless grinding through enemies because killing the same three things in the same three ways for no reward is fun nonesense.  Which is a very obious plus for the game, really its almost a neutral point as in 2013 we should and often do expect games not to have cookie cutter enemies and areas.

Next is the Vigor system, while very limited each Vigor offers two modes of use, and can be used in conjunction with other vigors if you are fast enough making for some unique results and clever ways to kill.

Then we have the true 1910's visual style, it really captures the old world feel of the last century and even includes a number of "modern" songs played/sung out on old instruments and in older styles. Pay particular attention for the rather well done rendition of "girls just want to have fun." 

Now finally, and the one true saving grace for the game is the companion system.

Elizabeth is done with such detail from her posture, to her fidgeting fingers, her facial expressions, tone of voice, and scripted reactions to even your own actions in game and in fluff pieces that she really feels alive, you'll find yourself developing a emotional attachment to her early on.  In fact I found myself rather provoked at the deal revelations involving her late in the game.  She is done so perfectly infact while I would rate this game a 5/10 as a decent FPS I would go so far as to move it up to a 6/10 or even 7/10 solely because of her. She is the central facit of the game after all, give us the girl, erase the debt.

I hope Elizabeth will be a example to all developers of how to do companions in any game in the future. This is certainly the one thing they have gotten absolutely right with this game!
an amazing plot and story line, the only thing is that ending of the story which confused me. Constant and variables, nice.

Buy it. If you enjoy a good story, then this is a must, the story is phenomenal. I don't know what drugs the writers we're doing at the time, but if I was to write a story, I'd buy some of those drugs.
P.S - I also recommend those drugs.

Bioshock３作目にして没落せずしっかり新しいゲーム性とストーリーを調和出来た作品。
直接繋がりのない続編ものとはいえ、ゲームとして劣化していないのが素晴らしい。
ラストに至るまでの展開もしっかりBioshockらしさを残してる。
ただし、科学や思想や宗教等詰め込みすぎた結果、リアリティラインが曖昧な所は否めない。
前提としてある程度キリスト教について理解があったほうが良い。
メタスコア90は妥当。
This game it's just AWESOME, worth of every cent and more!

Bioshock infinite was a game that promised to be a breakthrough in videogame interactive story telling, while the end product ended up not being the great epic that it was built up to be, the game still resides as a stellar example of a game telling a good story. Something that most games have been very bad at lately, instead focusing on having the most bonerific graphics and saturating all of the colors to various shades of shit brown and gun metal grey. Bioshock infinite manages to have both beautiful graphics and a plot with actual substance. Elizabeth represents a significant step forward for female characters in videogames especially since players will be able to play as her in burial at sea part 2. The gameplay in Infinite is more akin to a modern shooter, the levels are more linear, there is less exploration, fights are more scripted, and the combat system only lets you equip two weapons and two vigors at a time. While the violence and fighting is a key point of the game's story and gameplay the combat is quite lacking. I rarely used the vigors and even then I only found a few to be useful, the enemies take way too much damage, and there is a lack of variety especially with the heavy hitters. Most of the time you rarely see the heavy hitters, and they are few and far between. The only heavy hitter that appears a lot is the motorized patriot and there are too many of those. Also the enemy encounters seem less organic. In the original Bioshock you stumbled upon enemies and proceeded to fight them, in infinite not so much. A lot of the game is just walking across a relatively dead city as many parts of it are deserted and you cannot really interact with NPCs besides Elizabeth who always creepily stands right behind you silently when you turn around after walking and losing sight of her. The NPC interaction is sort of like Final Fantasy XIII in which you walk next to them and they might say something to you. The other major plot problem aside from the alternate timelines, which actually is handled better than most is a lack of presence of the antagonist. In the original Bioshock the antagonist would constantly try and harrass you over your radio, giving you the feeling that they are omnipresent and omnipotent. Here Both Major antagonists sort of say "come at me bro" to you and then you never hear from them again until you go kill them. I personally thought that the ending was appropriate. If I were to rate the base game I would give it an 8/10 but then burial at sea came out. I don't know about you but every hardcore bioshock fan such as myself shit their pants when they learned about burial at sea. Finally the ONE thing that we all wanted to see from bioshock finally arrived. It only took six years three games and a DLC, but we finally got it. Most of the major problems with game play are addressed. The enemy encounters are organic, the combat is balanced, and the final fight with the big daddy is climactic.
If you need one more person to recommend this game to you, you've been living in a cave under a rock on another planet.  Buy it now.  Seriously. Why are you still reading this?
Amazing

This game definitely bought its way into my top 5 games. I had a fucking blast playing this game. Even though the game was a bit to straight forward and easy, I felt that the story overpowered the fact that it was too easy. I was captivated Almost every minute of the game, and just like a good book it always kept me wondering what would happen next. Another reason why this game is most definitely in my top 5 is because of Elizabeth. Holy shit, Elizabeth has a spot right next to Katarina as my favorite female characters in gaming. Elizabeth did not feel like your average Skyrim follower, or any other followers in any game. Elizabeth didn't ever body block me and take me out of the vibe of the game, if anything her being their kept me even more captivated.

In conclusion I give this game a Solid 9.8/10 The point .2 being that it was a bit short and straight forward, maybe if had some puzzles or some challenges. But other than that this game is fucking Boss Ass Beast.

Brilliant game wasent going into it expecting much finished it now hold it in almost same regard as the amazing orignal bioshock dont let the fact it has no multiplayer put you off buying it it a polished and very fun game that dosent hold your hand hardly at all 9.5/10

Well, Jesus. This is really incredible. I never really had any interest in any of the BioShock games. I didn't really like the design, sort of reminded me of a Twilight Zone episode that looked vibrant but had a pale story by comparison. I saw the trailer for infinite that caught my interest. My first thought was "Oh a floating city, cool." So I waited untill a few days ago to get it finally. Didn't know a thing about the story, all I knew was that Troy Baker voiced Booker. That motivated me to get it even more. 
So, let's start with the most important part of any game... the gameplay... yeah. I heard that the gameplay was really boring and repeatative, I was a little worried at first but warmed up to the salts and vigors system. So I really enjoyed the combat. the opponents always kept me on my toes, and the first Handyman encounter made me scream. Even with all the vibrant colors and designs, the game still has this creepy atmosphere that you can really appreciate. The only thing that I think should've been included are puzzles based on the elemental vigors. But one missed oppurtunity doesn't make a horrible game.
Next we have the second most important part: (for me the most important part but eh) the story. I won't even go into any detail because I would be giving away too many great fleshed out characters, twists and turns and of course AI's. This game sort of reminds me of the visual style of the old Wild Wild West games. Booker Dewitt being a drunken James West. It has a steampunk feel to it all and it doesn't feel dated or pretentious at all. So perfect story, and to quickly summarize; the graphics look great, that's the end of it. 
This is not my favorite game of all time, but I truly think it is a perfect experience and a wonderful story of choice, race, religion and of course the multiverse theory. All in all 9.9/10
Nice game :)

After finally getting my hands on the title I've been wanting to play so badly, being a huge fan of the first two games in the series, I played it. Holy tittyslapping jesus on a pogostick!! This game is one of the most awesome experiences I've had gamewise in god knows how long (if he existed, hehe).  I was breathtaken by the beutiful designs, the emmersive enviroments, and the interesting characters, the graphics were beutiful to say the least, and the sound design was top notch. But what made me come back for more and more until I finished it, in one and a half day, was the story. The story had me holding my breath just to not miss one detail of it. And the ending left me cascades of shivers throttling down my spine like angry snakes, out of all the emotional bursts of joy, sadness and shock it gave me, I highly recommend this to everyone, especially those who played the first two! WOW! This game is really something out of the ordinary.

This is possibly the best bioshock i've ever played. The art form is very unique, and well planned. This is a very good game. Buy it... you wont regret it

This is an amazing game. Like honestly one of the best if not THE best I’ve played in a really long time. The Tie ins with the First and second are just perfect Subtle but perfect. The graphics were overwhelming at first to the point where I found myself Stopping and staring at the various birds and flowers they had everywhere it’s just beautiful. The story was amazing and mind blowing it kept me on the edge of my seat through the whole thing. It was so deep and complex. By the end my head was pounding I loved it though it wasn’t a normal headache but one that made me feel like my mind had expanded. The characters were very complex and very well voiced. Elizabeth actually became my favorite Female game character of all time. I like her so much at the times she was in trouble or captured my heart would sink and I’d start raging through everything and everyone to get her back even if it meant passing up loot. XD Overall this game gets a 10/10 In my book I highly recommend it. :D

Je me suis lançé dans ce jeu sans connaître du tout la saga (merci les soldes steam) et j'ai trouvé ce jeu absolument ahurissant, malgré les nombreuses séaquences scriptées, ce jeu a été très agréable. D'une grande fluidité dans le scénario et les découvertes de l'univers, on ne s'ennuie jamais. Les très nombreux oeufs de pâques sont très plaisant (j'ai adoré les covers de tears for fears et de cindy lauper ^^).
Je me suis acheté les deux premiers jeu juste après avoir fini cet épisode pour voir comment tout ceci à démarrer. Du grand art.

I found BioShock Infinite to be another good game in the series. After tweaking a few keybindings, the game's controls felt very comfortable and I was able to enjoy the fast paced combat to its fullest. One of the strongest aspects of this game is the storyline. It keeps a decent pace and gets you emotionally connected to your companion, a peculiar girl whose manerisms and bright eyes personality make her difficult not to like. She also adds a handful of interesting mechanics that prevent her from being a random NPC who follows you.
Bioshock Infinte ist ein Spiel, dass man gespielt haben muss!!
bellissimo consigliato

I will definitely recommend Bioshock Infinite.
But Im writting thsi review is not for the Main Game , but the DLC , Burial at Sea Episode 1 

Pro 
1) 101% new enviroment , you return back to the underwater city of Rapture 
2) Somehow the graphic and scenary seems alot better in Burial at Sea DLC , the underwater city is gorgeous just like the floating city of Columbia 
3) Remade of the weapon system , just like in Bioshock 1 , your able to carry more than one gun and switch to any other weapon as much as you want. Unlike in Bioshock Infinite which your only restricted to two weapons and you have to look for new weapons to switch them. 
4) Remade healing effect of food , much more balance and logic to it. 
5) New Vigor / Eve as they called it in Burial at Sea
6) New weapon skin and weapons
7) Great storyline , so far.
8) Able to swap clothing , even ones previous you found.  

Con 
1) Too short for Episode 1 , not worth the 14.99$ at all. 
2) Game feels unbalance 
3) Very limited amount of ammo your able to carry. 

I won't recommend anyone buying Burial at Sea Episode 1 for the time being , for the gameplay if not mistaken I think it's less than 3 hours depend on how you play it and for 14.99$ even an Indie game could last longer and gives you more entertainment than that..
I say two choices 
1) Wait for Episode 2 to realease and hopefully it's lot longer 
2) Just ignore this DLC and continue to enjoy Bioshock Infinite and save that 19.99$ (Season Pass) / 14.99$ (Burial at Sea Episode 1) for some other better games / DLC maybe coming in future ?

Озон671геймс как-то сказал: "качков нет - игра говно". Но мы-то не такие, мы утонченные ценители. С пивком покатит, в общем.
why not recommend this?

Ich bin ziemlich genervt, weil ich das Spiel nicht zum laufen kriege. Ständig wird mir angezeigt, dass der Grafiktreiber veraltet ist und ich habe ein blaues Bild am Bildschirm. Habe auch irgendwo gelesen das der Bildschirm Full HD benötigt. Ich habe aber nur HD ready. Das hätte Steam erwähnen müssen. Dann hätte ich das Spiel überhaupt nicht gekauft.

Außerdem ist es traurig, dass ich Steam nicht mehr direkt anschreiben kann. Es sind nur vorgefasste Antworten zu dem Spiel vorhanden. Also kann ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen, da ich es nicht spielen kann. 

Und man sollte genau aufpassen was man runterlädt, da es wohl häufiger zu Problemen kommt und man dann alleine gelassen wird. Eigentlich hatte ich aufgepasst und die Systemanforderungen haben gepasst.....


Nachtrag zu meiner Bewertung. Mittlerweile habe ich das Spiel zum laufen gekriegt, aber die ganzen Tipps und Tricks im Netz haben mir nicht wirklich geholfen. War aber eine Einstellungssache bei der Bildschirm-Auflösung meines LCD-Fernsehers.

Verstehe es aber trotzdem nicht so ganz, weil diese Einstellungen ja auch bei anderen Spielen laufen... wie gesagt: "Nur der Zufall hat mir geholfen":

Zum,Spiel muss ich sagen, dass es mir ausgesprochen gut gefällt. Es ist zwar ein Ballerspiel (und eines von der brutaleren Sorte), aber die Atmosphäre, Story, Grafik und vor allem auch die Musik fesseln einen so sehr, dass man es jeden Tag spielen möchte
Одна из лучших концовок которых я видел!

This game still stands as my number 1 favourite game of all time! Everything from the artwork, voice acting, gameplay and story was perfection. A pity the game's company shut down, the bioshock series is, one of a kind.

You just can't go wrong with a Bioshock game. You start for the gameplay and you stay for all the hidden little things and cool side quests.

I know many people rave about this game and how perfect it is, and while it is a good game and I have enjoyed playing it, it is far from being perfect. 

There are many times when the world seems incomplete and there is little you can actually interact with, except for the few objects the designers place there. There's nothing like being surrounded by bushels of apples and only being able to eat two; and this situation is relatively common -- instead you are picking candy bars out of trash cans to give yourself health (even when you are in a store filled with food). 

Many objects might as well have the mass of a sun and be made out of titanium, they can't be moved and you can't effect them at all. Except for being visible, it is like they don't even exist. This & not being able to go to obvious places like a wall is in your path, are two of my pet peaves; and Bioshock is guilty of both of them, at times. 

I also find it frustrating that you can't carry multiple health packs.

Flat textures and/or low res texturing is another issue that plaques the game. It can certainly take away from the otherwise beautiful environments. They reuse a lot of assets as well, especially faces and voices. Sometimes it has a creepy feel like some sort of genetic experiment gone wrong. People in the game sometimes act very creepy and unhuman in the way they move and interact - very distracting.

The save system is a mess, I thought developers had moved past having waypoints you had to reach to save your progress, but that is what they use. It is irritating when you have to exit the game, just to find out later that you have to replay fifteen minutes of game time to get back to where you were. I wish they would fix it.

There is some beautiful stuff in the game and they do a good job on the action, but it isn't revolutinoary by any means. Honestly, Bioshock Infinite doesn't push into any unexplored areas; it has a lot of hunt and peck type looting, with a very linear story line: Go to point A, shoot everybody, - dialogue - go to point B, shoot everybody - dialogue. Repeat. 

In this respect, it is very much similar to the original. But they do it in a very entertaining way that is guranteed to keep your attention...

Bioshock Infinty represents a wonderful example of modern gaming. The makers have made a few mistakes, but otherwise, they have made a great game using tried and true techniques, nothing new, but still excellent.
Absolutey beautiful game. Gripping story and addictive gameplay. This really expands the franchise and the world of Bioshock to a whole new level. You will not be dissapointed.

Got this on Steam Sale, and I must say this purchase is worth it. Probably the best RPG shooter I have ever played. A story that keeps you off your seat every moment, Gameplay that's very versatile with various abilties to use. And the sound and graphics keeps you immerse into the entire game. However, a bit extreme on violence and "culture" that's was back in the 1910s. Not recommended if you don't like that. Still, worth the buy when it goes on sale or not.
freaking trippy

Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful work. Almost every time I would enter a different environment I would have to stop and look around just to take it in; the game has a very subtle art style and makes fantastic use of colour and a kind of matte, almost comic style. The sound design was elemental to the experience and does a fantastic job of drawing you in and setting a mood, I know that the cry of the songbird will stick with me long after I stop playing. I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants a good shooter or is interested in a great story.

A terrific game with one of the best stories I've ever seen in a videogame. It made my jaw drop. Don't question buying it, just do it. And if you are wondering if you need to play the past Bioshock titles, you don't need to, but you get some of the references made in the game if you do.
역시 기대 했던것 만큼 그 이상을 보여준 게임 다만 스토리를 다 보여주지 않고 DLC 로 판매한다. 시즌패스를 구입한 유저라면 상관없지만 그러지 않은 유저는 에피소드가 게속 나올때 마다 구입해야한다.

인피니티는 진리입니다.

정말... 흠 잡을데라구요? 이 게임의 흠을 생각하는 제가 흠이라고 생각될 정도로 이 게임은 완벽합니다!!

스토리 좋구요, 그래픽 말끔하구요, 최적화 잘되있구요, ( 신적화...라고까지는 말 못하겠습니다만... ), 타격감 좋지요, 난이도 조정 잘해놨지요. ( 쉬움에선 정말 쉽고, 보통에선 정말 보통이고, 어려움에선 정말 어렵다는 말입니다 하하하ㅏ핳)

이런 게임을 해보고 싶다면 토렌트 들어가서 찾지 말고 세일할때라도 당장 사세요, 지금도 DLC 는 꾸준히 나오고 있습니다.

I give it 7.5/10

BioShock Infinite, like the rest of the of the BioShock franchise, was very enjoyable to play, combat was highly enjoyable and graphics were great. However I'd still say that the original BioShock was alot more entertaining.

I was slightly disappointed that BioShock Infinite didn't live up to expectation set by developers in early production. Even elements shown in the Beta game-play seemed to be non-existent: such as being fired at with artillery weapons and having a telekinesis power to stop the shells, sandbox level design, larger and more open areas and the random collapse of buildings as well as random weather events. However due to time, story and technology restraints many of these features were unrealistic so many of this is excusable - yet still leaves me mildly disspointed.

Also I found the ending to be a bit weak, but enjoyable none-the-less. The re-playability is also somewhat non-existent do to the linear level design that isn't present in the previous BioShock games that would have left you searching through every corner of the map in the hope that you may have missed something. I still strongly recommend playing the game. Good job 2K.
une fin vrm super a la quel on s'attend pas mais que a la fin ac le recule on aurais pus la voir venir. 9/10
This game is just pure perfection in every way and the plot line is something that just completely blew my mind, anyone who hasn't played, needs to play.
